$Tom Gorzelanny took the throw from Derrek Lee and stepped on the bag before Xavier Paul but Paul was called safe by 1B umpire Jerry Layne; Cubs manager Lou Piniella went out and argued the call with Layne

$Ron Belliard swung at a ball that bounced in the batter's box and then hit him on the lower leg; the ball caromed into the stands on the first base side and both runners advanced; however, the play was ruled strike three and a dead ball according to the rules and Matt Kemp was put back at first base
$the first pitch to Matt Kemp was up and in and Kemp hit the ground; HP umpire Adrian Johnson walked Matt Kemp part way down the line and then warned both teams

ej,schab801,C,johna901,Arguing interntional throwing at batter $the first pitch to Russell Martin was up and in; Dodgers Bench Coach Bob Schaefer yelled from the dugout at HP umpire Adrian Johnson that pitcher Denny Bautista should be ejected for throwing at Martin; Schaefer was ejected by Johnson and then Schaefer went out to argue; Dodgers manager Joe Torre also went on the field; 1B umpire and crew chief Tim McClelland ran in and told Schaeffer to leave the field and there were a few heated words in that discussion, too

ej,torrj101,M,johna901,Intentional HBP ej,kersc001,P,johna901,Intentional HBP Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw and manager Joe Torre ejected by HP umpire Adrian Johnson; automatic ejections due to earlier warnings

$Dodgers acting manager Don Mattingly went to the mound to discuss how to pitch and play Andres Torres; as Mattingly left the mound, first baseman James Loney asked a question so Mattingly turned to go back and give an answer; since Mattingly had left the dirt cirle, he was considered to have made a second trip to the mound; Giants manager Bruce Bochy talked to the umpires, who huddled and then removed pitcher Jonathan Broxton from the game (rule 8.06); crew chief Tim McClelland told Sherrill he could have all the warm up pitches he needed but HP umpire Adrian Johnson stopped him at 8 the umpires applied an incorrect penalty in this case because the rule specifies that the manager is ejected and the pitcher must pitch to the current batter; the pitcher is then removed from the game; in this case, the pitcher was removed during the plate appearance and the manager remained in the game
